channel.title: STA 199: Intro to Data Science on STA 199 | Intro to Data Science

item.description:
Note: This schedule may be updated as the semester progresses, with all changes documented here. Due dates for the exams and project will not be changed.
Date Activity Slides Reading Lab HW Exam Project Week 01 Tue, Aug 18 Lec 01: Introduction Thu, Aug 20 Lec 02: Meet the toolkit Fri, Aug 21 Lab 01: First steps in data science Week 02 Tue, Aug 25 Lec 03: Data visualization 1 Thu, Aug 27 Lec 04: Data visualization 2 Fri, Aug 28 Lab 02: Data visualization Week 03 Tue, Sep 01 Lec 05: Data wrangling/manipulation 1 Thu, Sep 03 Lec 06: Data wrangling/manipulation 2 Fri, Sep 04 Lab 03: Data wrangling/team workflow Week 04 Tue, Sep 08 Lec 07: Introduction to probability Thu, Aug 10 Lec 08: Applications of conditional probability HW 01 assigned: Lectures 01 - 08 Fri, Aug 11 Lab 04: Merge conflicts and more data wrangling Week 05 Tue, Sep 15 Lec 09: Data science ethics Thu, Sep 17 Lec 10: Estimation via bootstrapping Fri, Sep 18 Exam 01 assigned: Lectures 01 - 08 Week 06 Tue, Sep 22 Lec 11: The hypothesis testing framework Thu, Sep 24 Lec 12: Simulation based testing Fri, Sep 25 Lab 05: Statistical inference with simulations Final project: Introduction Week 07 Tue, Sep 29 Lec 13: The Central Limit Theorem Thu, Oct 01 Lec 14: Inference with the CLT Fri, Oct 02 Lab 06: Statistical inference with the CLT Week 08 Tue, Oct 06 Lec 15: Two-sample inference 1 Thu, Oct 08 Lec 16: Two-sample inference 2 HW 02 assigned: Lectures 09 - 16 Fri, Oct 09 Lab 07: Two-sample inference Week 09 Tue, Oct 13 Lec 17: Special topics Thu, Oct 15 Lec 18: Introducing the linear model Fri, Oct 16 Exam 02 assigned: Lectures 09 - 16 Week 10 Tue, Oct 20 Lec 19: Multiple linear regression Thu, Oct 22 Lec 20: Model diagnostics and assessment Fri, Oct 23 Lab 08: Linear models Peer feedback assigned Week 11 Tue, Oct 26 Lec 21: Classification HW 03 assigned: Lectures 18 - 21 Thu, Oct 28 Lec 22: Text and sentiment analysis Fri, Oct 29 Lab 09: Classification Week 12 Tue, Nov 03 Lec 23: Spatial data visualization Thu, Nov 05 Lec 24: Web scraping Fri, Nov 06 Exam 03 assigned: Lectures 18 - 21 Week 13 Tue, Nov 10 Lec 25: Functions and automation Thu, Nov 12 Lec 24: Special topics Fri, Nov 13 Project work day Week 14 Reading period: project work day Week 15 DATE Project presentations

item.title: Course Policies
item.description: Important Administrative Details STA 199 Academic Honesty Academic honesty is of paramount importance in this class, and all work must be done in accordance with the Duke Community Standard, reproduced as follows: To uphold the Duke Community Standard: I will not lie, cheat, or steal in my academic endeavors; I will conduct myself honorably in all my endeavors; and I will act if the Standard is compromised. By enrolling in this course, you have agreed to abide by and uphold the provisions of the Duke Community Standard as well as the policies specific to this course.
